description: The round payoff this round was 5. You, John chose to play option 2.Kate chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of -5000.

Mutual use of option 2 is extremely risky. When both players choose option 2, the round input is multiplied by 1000 to produce a massive negative payoff—as seen in the recorded round (input 5 leading to a payoff of –5000).

Deepseek-R1’s default strategy is to choose option 1. This suggests that under normal circumstances it avoids the high-risk option 2, so there is an incentive for John to deviate from his default (option 1) and pick option 2 to gain a positive payoff, if he is fairly confident the opponent sticks to its default.

The fact that in the key memory Kate also chose option 2 indicates that she can, under some circumstances, deviate from her default strategy. This may imply adaptive behavior or a strategic shift that can lead to mutual losses if both players choose option 2.
